title: President Trump Remarks on Missile Defense Review
description: President Trump traveled to the Pentagon to announce the results of the administration’s missile defense review. At the start, the president addressed the ongoing partial government shutdown and offered his condolences to the families of the four Americans killed in Syria. Acting Defense Secretary Patrick Shanahan and Vice President Mike Pence provided introductory remarks.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Venezuela Solidarity Event
description: Vice President Pence spoke at a Venezuela solidarity event held in Miami, Florida.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting with Venezuelan Exiles
description: Vice President Pence traveled to Miami, Florida, to meet with Venezuelan exiles and community leaders to hear their stories. He was joined by second lady Karen Pence and Florida Republican Senators Rick Scott and Marco Rubio.

title: Vice President Pence Visit to Challenger Crew Memoria
description: Vice President Mike Pence paid his respects to the Challenger Space Shuttle crew, who died in January 1986, when the shuttle exploded shortly after launch. He also visited the memorial to the crew of the Columbia Space Shuttle who perished in 2003.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Drug Trafficking
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks to directors and deputy directors of the High Intensity Drug Trafficking Areas (HIDTA) program.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on NASA Day of Remembrance
description: Vice President Mike Pence and NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine laid a wreath at the graves of astronauts Gus Grissom and Roger Chaffee and paid tribute to them and the Space Shuttle Challenger and Columbia crews.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to U.S. and Polish Troops in Warsaw
description: In a speech to U.S. and Polish troops in Warsaw, Poland, Vice President Pence said the free world needs a “strong and united” NATO. He reaffirmed U.S. commitment to the transatlantic alliance, saying that “an attack on one is an attack on all.”

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Middle East Summit in Poland
description: At a Middle East conference in Warsaw, Poland, Vice President Mike Pence called on European countries to join the United States in leaving the Iran nuclear deal. In his remarks, the vice president condemned Iran’s actions in the region and criticized the decision by some European partners to create schemes that he said would “break American sanctions.” The summit, organized by the United States, included representatives from dozens of European and Middle East countries.

title: Vice President Pence and Polish Prime Minister Visit to Warsaw Uprising Memorial
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki laid wreaths at the Warsaw Uprising Monument, followed by remarks from the vice president.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting with Polish Prime Minister in Warsaw
description: At a meeting with Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki in Warsaw, Vice President Mike Pence thanked Poland for its joint opposition to Russia’s Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline to Europe, which the Trump administration says poses a security risk.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made remarks during a bilateral meeting at a Middle East security summit in Warsaw, Poland.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Munich Security Conference
description: Vice President Mike Pence addressed the inaugural John McCain Dissertation Award Ceremony at the Munich Security Conference. He paid tribute to the late senator and reflected on his visit to Auschwitz and the challenges facing the world.

title: U.S.-Ukraine Relations
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko made remarks before a meeting at the 2019 Munich Security Conference in Munich, Germany.

title: Vice President Remarks to Reporters in Munich, Germany
description: Vice President Mike Pence answered questions from reporters while at the 2019 Munich Security Conference in Munich, Germany.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting With Afghanistan President
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Afghanistan President Ashraf Ghani made remarks before a meeting at the 2019 Munich Security Conference in Munich, Germany.The audio in this program is difficult to hear.

title: U.S.-NATO Relations
description: Vice President Mike Pence met with NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg at the 2019 Munich Security Conference in Munich, Germany.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at 2019 Munich Security Conference
description: Vice President Pence Mike Pence spoke at the 2019 Munich Security Conference in Germany. He talked about foreign affairs, including NATO, U.S. trade relations with China, penalties on Russia, defeating ISIS in Iraq and Syria, and de-nuclearization of North Korea and President Trump’s upcoming meeting with Kim Jong Un in Vietnam. He also called on European countries to join the U.S. in confronting Iran and the regime of Nicolas Maduro in Venezuela.

title: President Trump Space Force Signing Ceremony
description: President Trump signed another presidential directive concerning a Space Force. He also spoke about his upcoming summit with North Korea’s leader, trade talks with China, and more than a dozen U.S. states filing a lawsuit over his declaration of a national emergency to get more federal funds to build a U.S.-Mexico border wall. The president denied when asked by a reporter if he asked Acting Attorney General Matthew Whitaker to see if U.S. attorney Geoffrey Berman could be put in charge of the Southern District of New York’s probe into his former personal attorney, Michael Cohen, dismissing it as “more fake news.”

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to National Governors Association Luncheon
description: Vice President Mike Pence and second lady Karen Pence spoke at a luncheon for the nation’s governors, who were in Washington for the National Governor’s Association winter meeting. NGA Chair Governor Steve Bullock also made remarks.

title: Vice President Pence Press Availability in Bogota, Colombia
description: Following a meeting with Acting President of Venezuela Juan Guaidó, Vice President Mike Pence spoke to reporters about the evolving situation there and pledged additional aid. He also appealed to the military to abandon the Maduro regime.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting with Colombian and Venezuelan Leaders
description: Vice President Mike Pence met in Bogota with Colombian President Iván Duque Márquez and Acting President of Venezuela Juan Guaidó.

title: Vice President Pence in Colombia Delivers Remarks on Venezuela
description: In remarks in Bogota, Colombia, Vice President Mike Pence condemned the most recent actions by the Nicolás Maduro-led regime in Venezuela, including the previous-weekend attack on an aid convoy trying to enter the country. He also pledgeed additional relief.

title: Border Security National Emergency Resolution Veto
description: President Trump signed the first veto of his presidency by rejecting a resolution that would have terminated his national emergency declaration for the U.S.-Mexico border. Vice President Pence, Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen, Attorney General William Barr, several sheriffs from across the nation, and parents of victims killed by undocumented individuals joined the president in the Oval Office for the signing.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Border Security
Vice President Meeting with Georgia Public Officials on Border Security
description: Vice President Pence met with state officials in Atlanta to discuss border security.

title: Vice President Pence with Families of Detained Citgo Executives
description: Vice President Pence met with family members of six Citgo executives detained by disputed Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to Iowa Flood Victims
description: Vice President Mike Pence visited Pacific Junction, Iowa and spoke to families, businesses, and the agricultural community impacted by severe flooding in the region.

title: President Trump Observes National Day of Prayer
description: President Trump, Vice President Pence, and the first and second ladies hosted an event recognizing National Prayer Day in the White House’s Rose Garden. They delivered remarks and heard prayers from a variety of faith leaders. There was also a musical performance by a church choir featuring Jonathan Cain, keyboardist for the band Journey.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting With Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau
description: Vice President Mike Pence met with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau in Ottawa, to discuss trade, the situation in Venezuela and other issues.

title: Vice President Pence and Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau Joint News Conference
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau held a joint news conference following bilateral talks on trade and other issues. Topics included the stalled USMCA trade agreement, Huawei and abortion laws in the U.S.

title: Vice President and Second Lady Tour Storm Damage in Oklahoma
description: Vice President Pence and Second Lady Karen Pence visit Tulsa, Oklahoma, to tour communities and speak to families affected by recent tornadoes in the region.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on D-Day 75th Anniversary
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke in Bedford, Virginia, at the National D-Day Memorial “Final Salute” 75th Anniversary Commemorative Ceremony.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks in York, Pennsylvania
description: Vice President Mike Pence talked about the Trump administration’s record on jobs and the economy in a speech at JLS Automation on in York, Pennsylvania. He was introduced by Labor Secretary Alexander Acosta.

title: Vice President Pence Comments on Mexico Tariff Talks
description: Vice President Mike Pence told reporters in York, Pennsylvania, that Mexico has to do more if it wants to avoid a five percent tariff on its goods beginning June 10, 2019. He also said he would update President Trump on the talks later that night.

title: Vice President Pence on Tariff Talks with Mexico
description: Before going to Bedford, Virginia, to commemorate the 75th anniversary of D-Day, Vice President Pence updated reporters on talks with Mexican officials to stem the flow of migrants as they face a threat of a five percent tariff beginning June 10, 2019.

title: President Trump Announces Second Term Run
description: President Trump announced he was running for a second term during a campaign rally at the Amway Center in Orlando. Vice President Pence made opening remarks, and first lady Melania Trump introduced the President. Outgoing press secretary Sarah Sanders also made brief remarks.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to Christians United for Israel Conference
description: Vice President Pence addressed the Christians United for Israel summit. He spoke about the Trump administration’s policies toward Israel and Iran.

id: The vice president’s remarks begin about 18 minutes into the program.
title: https://www.c-span.org/video/?462373-1/vice-president-pence-remarks-christians-united-israel-conference
description: Speech

title: Vice President Pence at Immigrant Processing Center
description: Vice President Mike Pence toured a McAllen, Texas, immigrant processing center along the U.S. southern border. He also made remarks to reporters.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable with Border Patrol Officials
description: Vice President Pence made remarks during a roundtable meeting with U.S. Border Patrol and Republican members of the Senate Judiciary Committee.

title: President Trump in Greenville, North Carolina
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Greenville, North Carolina, that included Vice President Mike Pence. The president mentioned congressional efforts to have him impeached and criticized four female freshman minority House members he recently tweeted about: Democratic Representatives Ilhan Omar (MN), Rashida Tlaib (MI), Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (NY), and Ayanna Pressley (MA).The president used language that some may find offensive.

title: Vice President Pence Speech on Moon Landing 50th Anniversary
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke about the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 Moon landing.

title: President Trump Participates in Pledge to America's Workers Celebration
description: President Trump marked the one-year anniversary of the signing of the Pledge to America’s Workers executive order aimed at creating more job training and opportunities for Americans. Speakers included Vice President Pence, Ivanka Trump and business leaders from Toyota and Lockheed Martin.

title: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper Welcome Ceremony
description: President Trump and Vice President Pence participated in a welcome ceremony at the Pentagon for Defense Secretary Mark Esper. He was confirmed as the 27th secretary of defense by the Senate with a 90-8 vote. Secretary Esper previously served as Army secretary from 2017 to 2019.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Workforce Development
description: Vice President Pence made remarks on workforce development and apprenticeship opportunities to employees of Miller Electric in Jacksonville, Florida. The vice president was accompanied by Ivanka Trump, daughter and assistant to the president.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Former Prison Inmates Job Training Roundtable
description: Vice President Pence and Ivanka Trump, the assistant to the president, participated in a roundtable discussion on job skills training for those with a criminal history. The discussion took place at Operation New Hope in Jacksonville, Florida.

title: Vice President Pence Fireside Religious Freedom Chat
description: At an event on religious freedom, Vice President Mike Pence addressed the recent mass shootings in El Paso, Texas and Dayton, Ohio. The vice president reiterated the remarks of President Trump saying, “Hate has no place in America, and the sinister ideologies of racism, bigotry and white supremacy must be defeated.” He went on to say that “justice will be swift and certain” and the full resources of the federal government will be available to assist law enforcement with investigating the shootings.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at World War II 80th Anniversary Event
description: Vice President Pence delivered remarks at an event in Warsaw, Poland, commemorating the 80th anniversary of the start of World War II. He was joined at the event by Frank-Walter Steinmeier, the German president, and Andrzej Duda, the Polish president.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Business Roundtable in Dublin, Ireland
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke at a meeting of American and Irish business leaders in Dublin, Ireland.

title: Vice President Pence Arrival in Shannon, Ireland
description: Vice President Pence and Second Lady Karen Pence arrived at Shannon Airport in Ireland, following official business in Dublin with Irish government leaders, including Prime Minister Leo Varadkar. The Pences stayed at President Trump’s Doonbeg property.

title: Vice President Pence News Conference With Irish Prime Minister Varadkar
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar spoke to reporters at a joint appearance in Dublin.

title: Vice President Pence Speaks to Reporters in Dublin, Ireland
description: Vice President Pence spoke briefly to reporters in Dublin, Ireland, following meetings with business leaders and Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar. The vice president discussed U.S.-Ireland relations, Brexit negotiations, and his decision to stay at President Trump’s property in Doonbeg, Ireland.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at U.S.-Iceland Trade and Investment Roundtable
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a roundtable on U.S.-Iceland trade and investment in Reykjavik, Iceland.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting with Icelandic President Johannesson
description: Vice President Mike Pence met with Icelandic Presdient Gudni Johannesson in Reykjavik.

title: Vice President Pence Comments to Reporters in Reykjavik, Iceland
description: Vice President Pence spoke to reporters outside Hofdi House in Reykjavik, Iceland, where then President Ronald Reagan met with Soviet Leader Mikhail Gorbachev in 1986. Topics include Brexit, and international tensions in the Arctic region.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting with Icelandic Prime Minister Jakobsdottir
description: Vice President Pence met briefly with Icelandic Prime Minister Katrin Jakobsdottir at Keflavik Airport in Reykjavik.

title: Vice President Pence Arrival at Lord Mayor's Trade Dinner in London
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Second Lady Karen arrived at the Lord Mayor’s International Trade Dinner at the Guildhall in London. The vice president declined to respond to reporters' questions about his confidence in Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: Vice President Pence Meeting with British Prime Minister Boris Johnson
description: Vice President Pence met with British Prime Minister Boris Johnson the day after the U.K.'s top politician lost two key votes in his House of Commons, one that bars him from steering Britain out of the European Union without a deal struck with leaders in Brussels and another that would’ve authorized a general election. Vice President Pence said the U.S. supported the U.K. in its efforts to leave the E.U. and was looking forward to working on a free trade agreement following Britain’s exit. Prime Minister Johnson said he hoped such a deal would lift current regulations stymieing the export of beef, lamb and other agricultural products to the U.S. and thanked the vice president for his support.

title: Vice President Pence at Lord Mayor's International Trade Dinner
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks at the Lord Mayor’s International Trade Dinner at the Guildhall in London.

title: President Trump in Fayetteville, North Carolina
description: President Trump held a rally in Fayetteville, North Carolina, one day before a special election in the state’s 9th Congressional District.

title: Presidential Remarks on Religious Freedom
description: President Trump, in New York City for the annual United Nations General Assembly, spoke about religious freedom. He announced the U.S. would pledge $25 million in aid to protect religious freedom, sites, and relics. U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Kelly Knight Craft and Vice President Pence also spoke before the president.

title: President Trump Remarks at Hispanic Heritage Month Reception
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a Hispanic Heritage Month reception at the White House. The president spoke about job and wage increases for Hispanic Americans, home ownership and border protection. Vice President Mike Pence also delivered brief remarks.

title: New Chair of Joint Chiefs of Staff General Milley Swearing-in Ceremony
description: President Trump attended the swearing-in ceremony for his new Joint Chiefs of Staff xhair, General Mark Milley, at Joint Base Myer-Henderson Hall in Arlington, Virginia. Vice President Pence, outgoing Joint Chiefs of Staff General Dunford, and Defense Secretary Mark Esper also attended the ceremony.

title: Vice President Pence Town Hall on USMCA Trade Deal
description: Vice President Pence made remarks in Waukee, Iowa, at an event hosted by America’s First Policies on the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA). He talked about the economic growth and employment opportunities that the USMCA will spur in the country. He also urged the Democrats in Congress to “put politics aside and pass the USMCA” instead of “spending all of their time on endless investigations and partisan impeachment.”

title: Vice President Pence News Conference in Turkey
description: Vice President Pence spoke with reporters in Ankara after reaching an agreement with Turkey on a 120-hour pause in military operations in northern Syria to facilitate the removal of Kurdish forces, to be followed by a permanent ceasefire.

title: President Trump Remarks on NASA Spacewalk
description: President Trump spoke briefly from the White House Roosevelt Room with NASA’s first all-female spacewalk crew, astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir. After the short conversation, the president spoke briefly with the press, discussing the Ukraine investigation and the ceasefire in Turkey.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to Service Members in Texas
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks to service members and veterans at U.S. Army Fort Hood in Texas.

title: Vice President Pence at Fort Hood
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a veterans transition roundtable at U.S. Army Fort Hood in Texas.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks in London, Kentucky
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke at a get-out-the-vote rally in London, Kentucky, for Governor Matt Bevin.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to First Responders in Kentucky
description: Vice President Mike Pence and second lady Karen Pence joined Kentucky Governor Matt Bevin (R) on the campaign trail and spoke with law enforcement and first responders in Williamsburg ahead of next week’s election.

title: President Trump Remarks at "Black Voices for Trump" Rally
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a “Black Voices for Trump” rally in Atlanta. The president talked about his administration’s record and touted jobs creation and low unemployment for African Americans. He also commented on the impeachment inquiry, House Intelligence Committee Chair Adam Schiff (D-CA) and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA). Housing and Urban Development Secretary Ben Carson introduced the president.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks in Green Bay, Wisconsin
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke at a shipyard in Green Bay, Wisconsin, about the future of shipbuilding.

title: President Trump Remarks at the White House
description: President Trump held an event in the White House Rose Garden to honor U.S. military dog Conan, who was wounded in the raid on ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. He was joined by first lady Melania Trump and Vice President Mike Pence.

title: President Trump Rally in Sunrise, Florida
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Sunrise, Florida. It was his first rally there since changing his residency from New York to Florida in late October. He talked about the impeachment proceedings, telling his supporters that the Democrats are going after him for “fighting for you,” because he is “exposing a rigged system.” He also mentioned the economy, immigration and his recent visit to Walter Reed Medical Center.

title: President Trump Hosts Education Empowerment Roundtable
description: President Trump hosted a roundtable discussion on education choice at the White House. Current and former students, parents and teachers, as well as a number of lawmakers talked about their education experiences and how they believe school choice provides better opportunities for students. At the beginning of the roundtable, President Trump commented on the Justice Department inspector general report on the origins of the FBI’s Russia investigation. The president called the report’s findings a “disgrace” and likened the FBI’s investigation into Russian interference to “an overthrow of government.”

title: Vice President Pence Remarks in Rochester, Pennsylvania
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke at a “Veterans for Trump” event in Rochester, Pennsylvania.

title: President Trump Hosts Roundtable with Governors on Regulation
description: President Trump hosted a roundtable with a number of state governors and local leaders to discuss efforts to cut regulations. The governors of Alaska, Arkansas, Idaho, Indiana, Nebraska, and South Dakota as well as the governor-elect of Mississippi joined the president at the White House to talk about how deregulation at the federal level had helped their states' economic prospects and what additional measures they had taken at the state and local levels in their respective states.

title: President Trump Rally in Toledo, Ohio
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Toledo, Ohio. He spoke of several topics, including jobs in Ohio, the U.S.-Mexico border wall, and the U.S. military. He also talked about the killing of Iranian General Qasem Soleimani by a U.S. military drone strike, asserting that the general was plotting to bomb the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad before he was killed. Vice President Mike Pence introduced the president.

title: Chief of Space Operations Swearing-in Ceremony
description: Vice President Pence swore in new Chief of Space Operations General John Raymond.

title: U.S.-China Trade Deal
description: President Trump signed phase one of the U.S.-China trade agreement from the East Room of the White House. The agreement places protections on intellectual property, ensures investment into U.S. agriculture and manufacturing, and has measures in place to prohibit currency manipulation. Joining the president for the signing was Chinese Vice Premier Liu He.

title: "March for Life" Rally
description: President Trump addressed the annual March for Life rally in Washington, D.C. He was the first U.S. president to speak in person at the event. The two-hour rally also included remarks by Vice President Pence and Karen Pence, congressional lawmakers, Focus on the Family’s Jim Daly, and several “pro-life” activists.

title: President Trump at White House Summit on Human Trafficking
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a White House summit on human trafficking. He was joined by Vice President Mike Pence and Bella Hounakey, a human trafficking survivor. Following his remarks, the president signed an executive order. The summit was hosted in honor of the 20th anniversary of the Trafficking Victims Protections Act (TVPA).

title: Vice President Mike Pence Remarks on School Choice
description: Vice President Mike Pence made remarks on school choice at Saint Francis de Sales School in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to Police in New Hampshire
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks to police officers at a “Cops for Trump” event in Portsmouth, New Hampshire.

title: Vice President Pence and Ivanka Trump Visit Portsmouth, New Hampshire
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Ivanka Trump spoke to voters at a diner in Portsmouth, New Hampshire, before a campaign rally with President Trump.

title: Vice President Mike Pence Remarks to South Carolina Corps of Cadets
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks to the South Carolina Corps of Cadets in Charleston.

title: Vice President Pence at Hoover Institution Board of Overseers
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a “fireside chat” at the Hoover Institution Board of Overseers.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at "Keep America Great" Rally
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks at a “Keep America Great” rally in Troy, Michigan.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to Michigan Farm Bureau
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks at Michigan Farm Bureau’s Lansing Legislative Seminar.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Cyber Cup Awards Presentation
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks at the Cyber Cup Awards presentation ceremony. Acting Homeland Security Secretary Chad Wolf also gave remarks.

title: President Trump Meeting with Pharmaceutical Executives on Coronavirus
description: President Trump met with pharmaceutical executives at the White House during the global outbreak of the coronavirus. Vice President Pence, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar, and several members of the president’s coronavirus task force were also in attendance.

title: President Trump Meets with Airline CEOs on Coronavirus
description: President Trump met with airline CEOs at the White House to discuss their efforts to contain the coronavirus outbreak. Many of the airline executives mentioned efforts to sanitize their aircrafts and expressed the need for a calm reaction to the outbreak. When asked if it was safe to fly, President Trump said it is in certain areas and encouraged domestic travel within the United States. He also reacted to Super Tuesday primary results and former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg dropping his bid for the Democratic nomination in 2020.

title: Vice President Pence Meets with Diagnostic Lab CEOs
description: Vice President Mike Pence discussed the coronavirus outbreak with several diagnostic lab CEOs. They discussed the progress made in the availability of coronavirus testing to make it more readily available nationwide. They also discussed the newly-formed consortium of diagnostic labs to focus on sharing coronavirus information across the industry to more quickly meet needs.

title: Vice President Pence Holds News Conference on Coronavirus in Washington State
description: Vice President Mike Pence held a joint news conference on the coronavirus with Washington Governor Jay Inslee (D) after the two met in Tacoma. Members of Vice President Pence’s Task Force also spoke including Deborah Birx, Robert Redfield, and Seema Verma.

title: Vice President Pence Holds Roundtable with Governor Inslee
description: Vice President Mike Pence held a roundtable on the coronavirus outbreak with Washington Governor Jay Inslee (D) after the two met in Tacoma.

title: Vice President Meets with Governor Inslee
description: Vice President Mike Pence met with Washington Governor Jay Inslee (D) in Tacoma, to deal with the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Vice President Pence at 3M
description: Vice President Pence responded to reporters' questions after attending a meeting with executives of 3M, the company which makes respiratory masks. He also said that the U.S. did not have enough coronavirus tests.

title: Vice President Pence at 3M
description: Vice President Pence metwith 3M executives in Minneapolis, Minnesota, to discuss respiratory mask supply amid the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Vice President Pence at 3M
description: Vice President Pence made brief remarks to reporters prior to a meeting with executives at 3M, a surgical-mask manufacturer.

title: President Trump and Vice President Pence Meeting with Insurance CEOs on Coronavirus
description: President Trump and Vice President Pence met at the White House with insurance CEOs on the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak. The vice president announced that private health insurance companies had agreed to waive co-payments on coronavirus testing and treatments.

title: President Trump Teleconference with Governors on Coronavirus Response
description: President Trump held a teleconference call with governors to discuss federal and state coronavirus response efforts. Other speakers included Vice President Pence, FEMA Administrator Peter Gaynor and White House Coronavirus Response Coordinator Dr. Deborah Birx. The teleconference took place at FEMA’s National Response Coordination Center in Washington, D.C. This is a portion of the event due to technical difficulties.

title: President Trump Meeting with Recovered Coronavirus Patients
description: President Trump and Vice President Mike Pence met with coronavirus patients who have recovered. The group came from Michigan, Arkansas and California. One man said he contracted the virus while on the Diamond Princess Cruise ship. Another couple believed they became infected during a ski trip and a former NFL player said a gas pump handle was the cause of his experience. Out of the group, two of them were given hydroxychloroquine as part of their treatment and told the president it helped them recover.

title: Vice President Pence at FEMA
description: Vice President Mike Pence visited the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) headquarters in Washington, D.C., to thank employees for their work in the federal response to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Visits GE Healthcare in Madison, Wisconsin
description: Vice President Mike Pence visited a General Electric (GE) Healthcare manufacturing facility where ventilators were being made in response to the coronavirus pandemic. He also participated in a roundtable discussion at the plant.

title: President and First Lady Celebrate Earth Day and Arbor Day
description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump participated in a tree planting ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House in celebration of Earth Day and Arbor Day. The president, Vice President Mike Pence, second lady Karen Pence and House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) delivered remarks before the tree planting.

title: President Trump Meeting with Industry Executives
description: President Trump met with industry executives on the government’s response to the coronavirus pandemic. President Trump and Vice President Pence thanked the industry leaders for their partnerships with coronavirus testing. The president added the testing continues to increase across the country.

title: President Trump Meeting with Governor of Louisiana
description: President Trump met with Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards (D) in the Oval Office to discuss the response to the coronavirus pandemic. During the meeting, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases Director Dr. Anthony Fauci detailed results from a new drug trial with hospitalized COVID-19 patients. The data from the trial showed that “remdesivir has a clear cut significant positive affect in diminishing the time to recovery,” Dr. Fauci explained. The president took questions from reporters in the room on testing, China and the World Health Organization.

title: President Trump Holds Roundtable with Industry Executives
description: President Trump held a discussion with business executives from various industries on reopening the U.S. economy amid the coronavirus pandemic. The president said he would like to see the country fully reopen “as soon as possible” but stressed this needs to be done in a safe manner. He also said, like many Americans, he too would like to get out and about, and hinted at a trip to Arizona soon for an event.

title: Vice President Pence Visits General Motors Plant
description: Vice President Mike Pence toured a General Motors (GM) plant in Kokomo, Indiana, which was making ventilators. He also delivered remarks.

title: Vice President Pence at General Motors Plant
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke to reporters after visiting the General Motors plant in Kokomo, Indiana. Topics included China’s responsibility in the coronavirus pandemic and whether Michael Flynn should be pardoned.

title: Vice President Pence Delivers PPE to Woodbine Rehabilitation Center
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered personal protective equipment (PPE) from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to Woodbine Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center in Alexandria, Virginia.

title: President Trump Meeting with Texas Governor
description: President Trump met with Texas Governor Greg Abbott (R) in the Oval Office to discuss the state and federal response to the coronavirus pandemic. Following brief opening remarks, the president answered reporters' questions on a range of issues, including the Justice Department’s decision to dismiss the criminal case against former National Security Adviser Michael Flynn. President Trump also talked about the White House military valet testing positive for COVID-19, saying he had very little contact with the individual. He went on to announce that White House staff would be tested once a day now. Other topics addressed included the economy, coronavirus testing, U.S.-Russia relations, and the shooting death of a 25-year-old African American named Ahmaud Arbery.

title: President Trump Remarks on National Day of Prayer
description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump made remarks at the National Day of Prayer Service in the Rose Garden at the White House. Vice President Mike Pence and second lady Karen Pence also spoke.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable on Securing Food Supply
description: While visiting Hy-Vee supermarkets headquarters in Des Moines, Iowa, Vice President Pence participated in a roundtable discussion on securing the nation’s food supply.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to Faith Leaders in Iowa
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a discussion at Westkirk Presbyterian Church in Urbandale, Iowa, with faith leaders on the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on religious communities and congregations.

title: Restaurant Executives Meeting at the White House
description: President Trump met with restaurant and industry executives at the White House to discuss the coronavirus pandemic response and reopening the economy. The industry leaders all agreed the Paycheck Protection Program had helped their businesses and asked the administration to consider a 24-week extension to the program. The president took questions from reporters and said he was “surprised” by the statement from Attorney General Barr earlier in the day, saying he does not foresee the Justice Department probe into the origins of the Russia investigation to lead to a criminal investigation of former President Obama or former Vice President Biden. President Trump also talked about his firing of State Department Inspector General Steve Linick, saying he had the right to terminate as president. He also stated that he had been taking hydroxychloroquine as a preventive measure against COVID-19 despite warnings from the medical community against its safety.

title: Vice President Pence and Florida Governor News Conference
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Florida Governor Ron DeSantis spoke to reporters after visiting with officials in Westminster Baldwin Park to discuss nursing home challenges amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence and Governor DeSantis Visit Restaurant
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Florida Governor Ron DeSantis (R) visited Beth’s Burger Bar in Orlando and discussed the phased economic reopening of the state amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Discussion with Hospitality and Tourism Industry Leaders
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a roundtable discussion in Orlando, Florida, with hospitality and tourism industry leaders on the phased reopening of the economy amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence and Governor Kemp News Conference
description: Vice President Mike Pence, Georgia Governor Brian Kemp (R), and Labor Secretary Eugene Scalia spoke to reporters at the Star Cafe in Marietta about the reopening of Georgia’s economy and the response to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Visit to Star Cafe in Marietta, Georgia
description: Vice President Mike Pence met with Georgia Governor Brian Kemp (R) for lunch at the Star Cafe in Marietta to discuss the phased reopening of the state’s economy.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable with Georgia Restaurant Owners and Executives
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a roundtable discussion with restaurant owners and executives at Waffle House corporate headquarters in Marietta, Georgia.

title: President Trump Hurricane Season Preparedness Briefing
description: President Trump held a meeting on the 2020 hurricane season. Experts said they expect an above-average year for storms, but FEMA is prepared. The president also spoke about continued construction of the southern border wall and COVID-19's impact on travel and immigration.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Reopening the Economy
description: Vice President Pence made remarks on reopening the economy to employees at Oberg Industries in Sarver, Pennsylvania.

title: Vice President Pence Visit to Restaurant in Springdale, Pennsylvania
description: Vice President Mike Pence visited a restaurant in Springdale, Pennsylvania, to talk with patrons about the opening of the state’s economy amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence with Faith and Community Leaders in Pittsburgh
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a listening session with faith and community leaders at Covenant Church in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

title: President Trump Roundtable Discussion on Seniors
description: President Trump hosted a discussion in the Cabinet Room on efforts his administration was taking to protect senior citizens amid the coronavirus pandemic. The president also responded to reporters' questions on a planned executive order regarding police reform, the Supreme Court’s ruling upholding workplace protections for gay and transgender individuals, the police shooting of an unarmed black man in Atlanta, and his lawsuit to prevent the publication of a book from his former National Security Adviser John Bolton.

title: Vice President Pence Tour of Winnebago Industries in Mason City, Iowa
description: Vice President Mike Pence toured Winnebago Industries in Mason City, Iowa, with Governor Kim Reynolds (R) as part of the Trump administration’s efforts to highlight the reopening of the nation’s economy amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Visit to Sally's Restaurant
description: Vice President Mike Pence visited with patrons at Sally’s restaurant in Mason City, Iowa. The visit was part of the Trump administration’s efforts to tout the reopening of the country’s economy amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Visit to Mason City, Iowa
description: Vice President Mike Pence toured Winnebago Industries and spoke to employees to highlight the reopening of the country’s economy.

title: Vice President Pence Visit to Mount Clemens, Michigan
description: Vice President Mike Pence had lunch at the Engine House in Mount Clemens, Michigan, to highlight the reopening of the country’s economy amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks in Michigan on Reopening the Economy
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks to employees at Casadei Steel Inc., on reopening the economy.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma
description: President Trump, in his first campaign rally since the coronavirus pandemic forced a shutdown of the country in March, spoke at a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma. He talked about the pandemic, presidential politics, and the economy.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable on School Choice
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a roundtable discussion on School Choice in Waukesha, Wisconsin.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Faith in America
description: Vice President Pence delivered remarks on faith in America in Pewaukee, Wisconsin.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Youngstown Police Department
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks at the Youngstown, Ohio, police department. He expressed his support for law enforcement and rejected calls to defund the police.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks in Ohio
description: Vice President Mike Pence traveled to Lordstown, Ohio, and delivered remarks on opening the economy at an event held at Lordstown Motors.

title: Vice President Pence at Celebrate Freedom Rally in Dallas
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke at the First Baptist Church of Dallas' Celebrate Freedom Rally.

title: Vice President Pence and Governor Greg Abbott News Conference
description: During a trip to Dallas, Vice President Pence spoke to the media, joined by Governor Greg Abbott (R-TX), Senator John Cornyn (R-TX), and members of the White House Coronavirus Task Force. They talked about the recent spike in new coronavirus cases in Texas, and the Vice President urged residents of the state to wear masks.

title: Vice President Pence and Coronavirus Task Force Brief the Press
description: Vice President Mike Pence and members of the White House Coronavirus Task Force briefed the press at the U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps headquarters in Rockville, Maryland, on the government’s coronavirus response. When talking about prevention methods, U.S. Surgeon General Dr. Jerome Adams stressed the need to wear face masks, saying, “it is not an inconvenience,” and that a face mask should be viewed as “an instrument of freedom for all Americans.”

title: Vice President Pence Holds News Conference with Arizona Governor
description: During a trip to Arizona, Vice President Pence spoke to the media, joined by Governor Doug Ducey (R-AZ) and members of the White House Coronavirus Task Force. They talked about the recent spike in coronavirus cases in the state. The vice president urged residents to wear masks.

title: Vice President Pence and Arizona Governor on Coronavirus Outbreak
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Arizona Governor Doug Ducey (R) spoke to reporters before a meeting to discuss the recent spike in coronavirus cases in the state. In the last 24 hours of the airing of this event, 4,878 cases had been reported along with 88 deaths.

title: Vice President Pence News Conference with Florida Governor DeSantis
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Florida Governor Ron DeSantis (R) spoke to reporters in Tampa following a closed-door briefing on the recent spike in the number of coronavirus cases in the state, and discussed steps needed to mitigate against further spread.

title: Vice President Pence and Florida Governor DeSantis Coronavirus News Conference
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Florida Governor Ron DeSantis (R) spoke about the recent spike in coronavirus cases across the state, and the next steps to mitigate against further spread of the deadly disease.

title: President Trump on COVID-19 and School Safety
description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump participated in a roundtable discussion with students, parents, teachers and medical professionals on efforts to reopen schools in the fall amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable on Reopening America
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a roundtable discussion on reopening America at Rajant Corporation in Malvern, Pennsylvania.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Law Enforcement Rally
description: Vice President Pence delivered remarks at a “Back the Blue” rally in Philadelphia.

title: Vice President Pence News Conference in Baton Rouge, Louisiana
description: Vice President Mike Pence held a news conference at Louisiana State University in Baton Rouge. Earlier in the day, Vice President Pence had a series of meetings on the state’s response to the coronavirus pandemic and its plans for reopening colleges and universities.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Coronavirus Pandemic Response
description: Vice President Pence made remarks at the State Emergency Operations Center in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. He talked about the state’s response to the coronavirus pandemic. Governor Edwards and Senators Cassidy and Kennedy also spoke.

title: President Trump Remarks on Rolling Back Regulations
description: President Trump delivered remarks from the White House South Lawn on deregulation. He touted his administration’s rescission of regulations, saying that doing so would help spur the economy and bring jobs back to the United States. The president also asserted that the plan of his Democratic presidential opponent, former Vice President Joe Biden, would threaten “our entire economy, and very way of life.”

title: Vice President Pence Visits Dairy Farm in Wisconsin
description: Vice President Pence hosted a roundtable on the economy and global trade with a variety of farmers in Onalaska, Wisconsin. At the top of the event, the vice president talked about the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement negotiated by the Trump administration. Then, the farmers taking part in the discussion commented and asked questions on the trade deal, which included many agriculture-specific provisions for U.S. food producers. During the event, Vice President Pence also thanked the farmers for working through the coronavirus pandemic, and at its conclusion, greeted many of those in attendance.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Trump Campaign Event in Ripon, Wisconsin
description: Vice President Pence delivered remarks on the economy and trade at Ripon College in Ripon, Wisconsin. The campaign event in support of President Trump’s reelection was held in the same town where the political group that became the Republican Party first met in 1854. During his speech, Vice President Pence cast the 2020 presidential election as a choice between prosperity under capitalism and hardship under socialism. He touted the administration’s response to the economic shutdown in response to the coronavirus pandemic, saying record job growth in states reopening their economies were bolstered by the anti-regulatory actions taken by the Trump White House.

title: President Trump Oval Office Remarks
description: President Trump spoke about ongoing negotiations with Congress for an additional coronavirus pandemic economic aid package. He also said he plans to bring back briefings to discuss response efforts and vaccine research and development. Vice President Pence, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY), and House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) also made remarks.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable on Reopening Schools
description: Vice President Pence and Education Secretary DeVos participated in a roundtable with South Carolina Governor Henry McMaster (R) on safely reopening schools amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Holds Coronavirus News Conference in South Carolina
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Gov. Henry McMaster (R-SC) held a press conference from the University of South Carolina in Columbia on reopening schools in the Fall of 2020. Despite the increased positive cases of the coronavirus in the South, they said that it is vital to reopen schools to ensure the educational and mental health of students, as well as providing essential services to students, such as meals and counseling. Also joining the vice president were Education Secretary Betsy Devos and Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) Administrator Seema Verma.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable on Reopening Schools
description: Vice President Pence participates in a roundtable in Indianapolis on safely reopening schools amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable on COVID-19 Vaccines
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a roundtable in Durham, North Carolina, on phase three COVID-19 vaccine trials.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on the Economy
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks in Somerset, Pennsylvania, on the economy.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks to Greensburg Police Department
description: Vice President Mike Pence addressed the police department in Greensburg, Pennsylvania.

title: Vice President Pence Campaign Stop in Clearwater, Florida
description: Vice President Pence delivered remarks to a group gathered in Clearwater, Florida. It was part of a multi-stop Sunshine State campaign trip focused on reaching evangelical and “pro-life” voters. The vice president was introduced by his daughter, Charlotte Pence Bond. His remarks largely contrasted himself and President Trump with Joe Biden, the presumptive 2020 Democratic presidential nominee, on such issues as abortion, religious freedom, and health care policy. Following his remarks, he met and greeted some of the attendees before departing the venue.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Religious Freedom
description: Vice President Pence delivered remarks at a Largo, Florida, church. At the campaign event sponsored by the “pro-life” Susan B. Anthony List political group, the vice president focused on religious freedom. The event was part of a multi-stop campaign swing through the Sunshine State, targeting evangelical and “pro-life” voters.

title: "Cops for Trump" Event in Arizona
description: At a “Cops for Trump” event in Tucson, Arizona, Vice President Mike Pence accepted the Arizona Police Association’s endorsement of President Trump’s reelection. Senator Martha McSally (R-AZ) and Arizona Governor Doug Ducey (R), who introduced the vice president, both talked about the reasons they were supporting the Trump-Pence ticket in 2020. During his remarks, the vice president said the Trump administration was committed to supporting law enforcement in its second term, and he thanked the police association for its support.

title: Vice President Pence Meets with Farmers in Des Moines, Iowa
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks at the Iowa State Fairgrounds to launch a “Farmers and Ranchers for Trump” coalition in support of President Trump’s reelection campaign. He was introduced by Governor Kim Reynolds and Senator Joni Ernst, both Iowa Republicans. During his remarks, the vice president encouraged those in attendance to vote for President Trump’s reelection as well as that of Senator Ernst. He also talked about the president’s Democratic challenger, Joe Biden, and Senator Kamala Harris (D-CA), who had been named as his running mate earlier in the week. Vice President Pence said the former vice president and Senator Harris were too progressive and would change the course of the nation.

title: Vice President Pence Hosts "Cops for Trump" Event in North Carolina
description: Vice President Pence delivered remarks at a “Cops for Trump” event held at the Raleigh-Durham International Airport in North Carolina.

title: Signing Ceremony with President of Serbia and Prime Minister of Kosovo
description: President Trump hosted a signing ceremony in the Oval Office with Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic and Kosovar Prime Minister Avdullah Hoti to normalize economic relations between the two Balkan countries. President Trump was then asked about a story in The Atlantic Magazine alleging he made disparaging remarks about fallen service members. “It’s a totally fake story,” he said, touting his record on the military and veterans. He noted that John Bolton, his former national security adviser, wrote about the incident in his book but did not mention the quotes referenced in the article. “To me, they’re heroes,” he said.

title: President Trump Remarks on Israel-Bahrain Agreement
description: President Trump announced an Israel-Bahrain deal from the Oval Office. He talked about the agreement and other recent deals between Israel and Arab countries.

title: President Trump Remarks at White House History Conference
description: President Trump made remarks at the White House History Conference at the National Archives in Washington, D.C. During his remarks, the president denounced what he called “left wing mob,” saying a “radical movement is moving to demolish our precious history.” He later said the “left” wanted “to impose a new segregation.” President Trump announced a new executive order to promote “patriotic education,” called the 1776 Commission. Vice President Pence introduced the president.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable in Arizona
description: Vice President Pence participated in a Libre Initiative roundtable in Phoenix, Arizona.

title: President Trump Delivers Remarks on Bay of Pigs Remembrance
description: President Trump delivered remarks honoring veterans of the Bay of Pigs invasion.

title: President Trump Rally in Newport News, Virginia
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Newport News, Virginia. He was introduced by Vice President Mike Pence.

title: President Trump and Vice President Pence Speak at Campaign Rally in Traverse City, Michigan
description: President Trump and Vice President Mike Pence spoke at a campaign rally in Traverse City, Michigan. There are about 16 minutes between the vice president and president’s remarks.

title: President Trump Remarks on Election Status
description: President Trump delivered remarks from the East Room of the White House on Election Night, before the race had been called. The president thanked his supporters and talked about the states he had won. President Trump also claimed that there were irregularities in the vote counting process. “This is a fraud on the American public. This is an embarrassment to our country. We were getting ready to win this election. Frankly, we did win this election,” he said.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Campaign Rally for Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler
description: Vice President Pence spoke at a rally in Canton, Georgia, for Republican Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler, both of whom were facing runoff elections in January 2021 that would determine control of the Senate. Senator Perdue was to face Jon Ossoff (D), and Senator Loeffler’s opponent was Raphael Warnock (D).

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Defend the Majority Rally
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke at a rally in Gainesville, Georgia, for Republican Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler. On January 5, 2020, Senator Perdue was to face Jon Ossoff (D), while Senator Loeffler would face Reverend Raphael Warnock (D) in runoff elections to determine control of the U.S. Senate.

title: COVID-19 Vaccine Distribution Roundtable in Memphis with Vice President Pence
description: Vice President Pence participated in a roundtable discussion on COVID-19 vaccine distribution.

title: Vice President Pence Campaigns for Georgia Republican Senate Candidates
description: Vice President Mike Pence campaigned for Republican Georgia Senators Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue in their runoff elections set for January 5. He also urged supporters to check their voter registration, request their absentee ballots, and to vote early.

title: Vice President Pence Campaigns for Georgia Republican Senators Perdue and Loeffler
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke at a campaign rally for Georgia U.S. Senate Republican candidates Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler. The two incumbent Georgia senators were running against Democratic candidates Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff on January 5, 2021, in the state’s two U.S. Senate runoff elections that would determine majority control of the U.S. Senate.

title: Vice President Pence Roundtable on COVID-19 Vaccine
Vice President Pence Hosts "Life is Winning" Event
description: Vice President Pence hosts a “Life is Winning” event in the South Court Auditorium.

title: Vice President Pence Campaigns for U.S. Senate Candidates in Macon, Georgia
description: Vice President Pence campaigned at a rally in Macon, Georgia, for Republican Georgia Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler, both facing January 5 runoffs.

title: Vice President Pence Campaigns for Senators Perdue and Loeffler
description: Vice President Mike Pence campaigned for Georgia Republican Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler at a rally in Columbus. The two senators both faced runoffs against Democratic challengers Jon Ossoff and Reverend Rafael Warnock after none of the candidates got more than 50 percent of the vote in the 2020 election. Senators Perdue and Loeffler talked about the importance of the election, which could decide which party controls the Senate in the 117th Congress. While Vice President Pence expressed support for President Trump’s continued legal battle to overturn the 2020 presidential election results, the vice president spoke of the Georgia Senate races as a chance for Republicans to “hold the line” against President-elect Joe Biden.

title: Vice President Pence Receives COVID-19 Vaccine
description: Vice President Mike Pence, second lady Karen Pence, and surgeon general Dr. Jerome Adams publicly received the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine at the Eisenhower Executive Office Building. Later, Dr.Anthony Fauci joined the vice president and surgeon general for remarks.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Space Force Anniversary
description: Vice President Mike Pence hosted a one-year anniversary celebration for the U.S. Space Force. He announced that the men and women of the service will be known as “Guardians.”

title: Vice President Pence at Turning Point USA Student Action Summit
description: Vice President Mike Pence delivered remarks at Turning Point USA in West Palm Beach, Florida. The vice president encouraged the audience to continue their support for President Trump and help elect Republicans in the Georgia Senate race. He also spoke about the president’s accomplishments and warned against the Democrats' policy agenda.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks at Georgia Senate Campaign Event
description: Vice President Pence campaigned for incumbent Republican Georgia U.S. Senate candidates, Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler. Both candidates were facing runoff elections with Democratic candidates Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock on January 5, 2021. The runoff would determine majority control of the U.S. Senate. Vice President Pence talked about the importance of Georgians voting and said he shares the concerns of some Americans about voting irregularities. The vice president told the crowd that "come this Wednesday, we’ll have our day in Congress. We’ll hear the objections. We’ll hear the evidence, but tomorrow is Georgia’s day".

title: Vice President Pence Visits National Guard Troops at the Capitol
description: After meeting with security officials, Vice President Mike Pence spoke to military members guarding the U.S. Capitol. He thanked the group of National Guard members from various states for their vital role deploying quickly following the Capitol attack and providing security leading up to Inauguration Day.

title: Inauguration Security Briefing
description: Vice President Mike Pence participated in a security briefing for Inauguration Day. Homeland Security, FBI, Secret Service, and National Guard officials outlined some of their plans to keep the event secure and safe. FBI Director Christopher Wray said the agency would remain in an aggressive posture through Inauguration Day. He added that investigators had identified more than 200 suspects in the January 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol. He also said that the FBI was tracking suspects still at large as well as anyone planning violence leading up to inauguration.

title: Vice President Pence Delivers Remarks at Chuck Yeager Memorial
description: Vice President Pence spoke at a memorial service for former test pilot and retired Air Force Brigadier General Chuck Yeager, who died on December 7, 2020, at the age of 97.

title: Vice President Pence Remarks on Trump Administration Foreign Policy Achievements
description: Vice President Mike Pence spoke at Naval Air Station Lemoore in California to highlight foreign policy achievements of the Trump administration. He talked about rebuilding the military, pulling out of the Iran nuclear agreement, peace in the Middle East, and American strength around the globe. He also thanked those in the military for their service and said it was “an honor” to be vice president for the last four years. Joining the vice president on stage was his second lady Karen Pence.

title: Vice President Pence Addresses Troops at Fort Drum, New York
description: Vice President Mike Pence and second lady Karen Pence traveled to Fort Drum, New York, for what the second lady told the audience was their “very last trip as vice president and second lady of the United States.” Vice President Pence thanked the members of the U.S. Army’s 10th Mountain Division for their service to the nation and reflected on the military accomplishments of the Trump administration. Representative Elise Stefanik (R-NY), a member of the Armed Services Committee and whose district includes Fort Drum, introduced second lady Karen Pence.
